title.narrative: HIV and TB prevention in TJK

description.narrative: The Project is aimed at ensuring effective HIV response measures, scaling up access for early and quality diagnosis, treatment and care, ensuring integrated care for those affected by TB and HIV and strengthening national public health response to C19

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Prevention programs for people who inject drugs (PWID) and their partners - 17,183 (77.4% of) people who inject drug (PWID) reached by prevention services - - 13,746 (61.92% of) PWID that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 80% of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Prevention programs for sex workers and their clients - 13,137 (74.64% of) sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services -10,510 ( 59.72% of) sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Prevention programs for MSM and TGs - 8,126 (60.64% of) MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 6,501 (48.51% of) MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results

Treatment, care and support - 9,305 (66,46 % of) adults and children currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with
HIV - 95.0% of adults and children that initiated ART, with an undetectable viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml) - 96% of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
TB/HIV - 100 % of people living with HIV in care (including PMTCT) who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings - 95% of living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy - 96% of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
TB care and prevention - 1,050 of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified - 1,050 of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment - 6,100 of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases - 68% of treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated - 82,43 % of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
